instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on No Chime No Display
threads.message: Hey guys I'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no signs of liquid damage unit turns on verified by plugging in a usb thumb stick with led on it. Fan spins when it gets hot, does not chime or display any video. S0 power rails have power, cpu vcore rail also has power. Any ideas on what the problem would be ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on No Chime No Display
threads.message: First do a PRAM reset, then check if you have video signal on external screen, there is no imagen on internal?? or just no backlight'??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on No Chime No Display
threads.message: Tried the pram reset and also an external display no change this unit definitely has no video.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on No Chime No Display
threads.message: Known good LCD? 2015 and up are unique, so get correct screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on No Chime No Display
threads.message: Yes Duke had another 2015 in the shop with good lcd tested and same problem

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on No Chime No Display
threads.message: First thing is to get a chime. If there is no chime then it hangs somewhere on POST.  Any other history on this thing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on No Chime No Display
threads.message: No good history on this thing upon inspection no signs of water damage very confusing as to why no chime and power rails are present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on No Chime No Display
threads.message:
This is going to suck. If all power is present and it is brain dead then it could be anything and everything. RAM/CPU/corrosion/dropped/BIOS, take your pick. 

Double check the chime and PRAM reset but after that this may be a no fix.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on No Chime No Display
threads.message: Shit, I have the exact same problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on No Chime No Display
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Tony Tone, post: 22798"]Shit, I have the exact same problem.[/QUOTE]

Any luck fixing your board Tony tone

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on No Chime No Display
threads.message: No, not yet.  Duke suggested the SMC because there was a drop of water there.  Once I catch up on my work I am going to give it shot. Will follow up.
